decks.notes: The deck focuses on using artifacts such as Paradoxical Outcome and Grim Monolith to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage. The goal is to assemble a powerful board state quickly, utilizing cards like Mishra's Workshop, Tolarian Academy, and Urza's Saga. Combining these resources allows for explosive plays and enables the player to win the game through various combos, including setting up a Time Vault combo with Voltaic Key or tutoring for game-winning artifacts with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tinker.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies while maintaining a strong board presence through the use of efficient creatures and powerful spells. It aims to control the game by utilizing disruptive cards like Collector Ouphe and Opposition Agent, while also utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf and Oko, Thief of Crowns to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes powerful card draw and selection spells like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm to help maintain card advantage and find key pieces to the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive while also disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around using Paradoxical Outcome as a key card to generate a large amount of card advantage and mana acceleration. It also utilizes powerful artifacts like Time Vault, Mana Crypt, and Moxen to create a winning combo. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is included as a companion to provide additional value and recursion. The deck aims to control the board with counter spells like Force of Will and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through a powerful combination of cards.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Paradoxical Outcome to generate massive card advantage and mana acceleration, allowing for explosive plays and rapid deck cycling. The inclusion of cards like Time Vault, Mana Vault, and Time Walk provide additional win conditions and ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's overall strategy revolves around efficient card draw, mana ramp, and the ability to consistently pull off game-winning combos. The companion card Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional synergy and recursion options to further enhance the deck's power level.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Narcomoeba, allowing for explosive combos with cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam. It also includes disruption with cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient strategy that can quickly close out the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and powerful spells. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up win conditions such as Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den. The deck includes a variety of powerful artifacts like Moxes and Sol Ring, as well as card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. By maintaining control of the game and leveraging efficient spells and permanents, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through efficient plays and resource management.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through disruption, card advantage, and stall tactics. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan using counterspells, removal spells, and stax pieces like Pithing Needle and Nihil Spellbomb. The deck also utilizes card draw spells like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage. Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo provides an alternate win condition. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion that can recur key cards from the graveyard. The deck's core strategy is to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing disruptive creatures like Thalia and Archon of Emeria to slow down the opponent while also deploying hate cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Chalice of the Void to disrupt their game plan. The deck also includes cards like Dauntless Dismantler and Loran of the Third Path to generate advantage and answer threats. With a strong mana base and disruptive elements, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive hatebear strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing self-mill effects like Bazaar of Baghdad and Stinkweed Imp to get Dredge cards into the graveyard, which trigger powerful effects like Narcomoeba, Ichorid, and Prized Amalgam to swarm the board quickly. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo. Creeping Chill provides additional reach and Noxious Revival can be used to retrieve key cards from the graveyard. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient graveyard-based combo strategy.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing the Combo - Paradoxical Outcome strategy to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. The deck includes key cards such as Paradoxical Outcome, Lrien Revealed, and Urza's Saga to quickly build a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent. Alongside powerful mana rocks like Black Lotus and Moxen, the deck also features disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. By efficiently cycling through the deck and leveraging artifacts and spells, the deck aims to win the game through a combination of card draw, mana ramp, and board control.

This deck revolves around utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards like Narcomoeba, Prized Amalgam, and Creeping Chill. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, the deck aims to quickly dredge cards from the graveyard, triggering powerful effects and overwhelming the opponent with a fast-paced combo strategy. The use of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation helps protect the combo pieces while cards like Grief and Hollow One provide early pressure and disruption to control the game tempo.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan using counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with removal spells like Fatal Push. It utilizes card advantage with cards like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes combo pieces like Time Vault and Voltron Revealed to close out the game quickly. The mana base is optimized for consistency and efficiency, with powerful mana rocks like Black Lotus and Moxen. The deck aims to control the game and win through incremental advantage and powerful combos.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful counterspells and removal spells, while also generating card advantage through cantrips and draw spells. It features a low mana curve and efficient spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recur key cards from the graveyard. The deck focuses on resource management and efficient play to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to bounce multiple artifacts and draw cards, generating value and increasing the chances of assembling a combo win condition. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo pieces and control the opponent. The presence of cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Urza's Saga provide additional recursion and utility, while the inclusion of powerful mana accelerants like Black Lotus and Moxen allows for explosive starts and fast-paced gameplay.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents while maintaining board presence through a combination of powerful threats and disruptive spells. It utilizes versatile cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to counter opponent's spells, along with Collector Ouphe to shut down artifact-based strategies. Deathrite Shaman and Tarmogoyf provide efficient threats, while Oko, Thief of Crowns can disrupt and control the opponent's board. The deck also has access to powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. By mixing aggression with disruption, the deck aims to overpower opponents in a fast-paced, interactive game plan.

This deck aims to win by playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Questing Druid, supported by powerful spells like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will. The deck also includes a high number of cantrips and card draw spells to maintain card advantage and ensure consistent draws. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to replay key creatures from the graveyard. This deck seeks to apply pressure on the opponent quickly while controlling the game with efficient removal and countermagic.
